descriptionOfStep:
# ** _ Step 3 _ **
## Git Status
When a directory is part of a repository, it is called a working directory.
The working directory contains the latest downloaded version from the repository, along with any changes that have yet to be committed.
When you are working on a project, all changes are made to this working directory.

To see the result of the previous step, try the command:
`` `bash
Â git status
`` ``
[! NOTE]
> \
The output of this command is called "working tree status".
